column4: Hi! I'm not in the best mood... for some *ret* reason I can't view/open/extract 2 tar/gzip files, I had em stored on another hdd, and a few minutes ago I ftp'd files - to my primary pc hdd, I can't view/extract/open the tars "an error occured" , any suggestions?
is this a problem related to "ubuntu"?
bug?
First I tried to view/extract/open them with my GUI (KDE) and it took several minutes until ark finally gave up by telling me "unknown error occured"
you mean like sudo tar xvz ?
Hexic.tar.gz (trying with ark GUI - kde) nothing happens for a few minutes which is weird, then ark pops up "An error occurred while trying to open the archive "
i've tried to tar extract them in console mode, nothign happens
gzip: Hexic.tar.gz: not in gzip format
how did you transfer the file? command-line ftp client?
no a GUI ftp - gftp
evry other file works, except these 2 big tar files
did these other files include smaller tar.gz files ?
both of them are in x.tar.gz
rory, my other hdd had 3 folders with several tar files  and 2 big tar files outside the folder location
i'd suggest try transferring the files again
ok
are both machines running ubuntu?
rory the other hdd was an external one, no os specified
20 seconds remaining until first tar is on my pc hdd
but you ftp'ed to a computer ... ?
yeah sort of, but nvm that, trust me this "hdd" can store different files despite os restrictions
